pr_title: [noTicket][RISK=NO]Send user demographic survey attribute Gender identity to RDR

timeline.message: Send user survey Gender identity to RDR

timeline.bodyText: Yeah, I like this better. It'll be cleaner definitely.
timeline.author: jaycarlton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -234,12 +234,11 @@ definitions:
   Gender:
     type: string
     enum:
-      - MALE
-      - FEMALE
+      - MAN
+      - WOMAN
       - NON_BINARY
       - TRANSGENDER
-      - INTERSEX
-      - NONE
+      - NONE_DESCRIBE_ME

timeline.bodyText:
nit: It takes a bit of getting used to, but I think it's cleaner to do
Optional.ofNullable(dbDemographicSurvey.getGenderIdentityEnumList())
    .map(g -> g.stream().map(RdrExportEnums::genderToRdrGender).collect(Collectors.toList()))
    .ifPresent(researcher::setGender);

if, null, and != should generally be minimized IMO.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: @jaycarlton : Do you mind taking another look?
replies.author: NehaBroad

timeline.message: Use optional.ofNullable and correct enum YES NO yaml error

timeline.bodyText: There is a bug in Swagger that converts ENUM YES and NO to true and false unless its Explicitly used as string "YES"
timeline.author: NehaBroad
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -281,10 +279,10 @@ definitions:
       - UNDERGRADUATE
       - MASTER
       - DOCTORATE
-      -
+
   Disability:
     type: string
     enum:
-      - YES
-      - NO
+      - "YES"

replies.bodyText:
😠
Can you please double-check that when this goes through our script to create merged.yaml that the quotes are still present? I'm worried they won't be.
In fact, I'm confused Swagger can distinguish the difference; by the time the YAML is loaded all bets are off w/r/t quotes.
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Since this is in RDR.yaml, merged.yaml doesnt have these changes
replies.author: NehaBroad

timeline.bodyText:
This confuses me. Either we have a boolean, in which case we don't need an enum, or we have an enum that describes  the situation like Disability.NOT_DISABLED, Disability.SOME, etc. But if you want to start an enum, it's hard to imagine what you'd add to yes and no.
Enums are definitely preferred over booleans for public APIs, but if the enum itself has true & false in it, I don't know that you're winning as much.
timeline.author: jaycarlton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,8 +72,8 @@
   private static final BiMap<Disability, org.pmiops.workbench.rdr.model.Disability>
       CLIENT_TO_RDR_DISABILITY =
           ImmutableBiMap.<Disability, org.pmiops.workbench.rdr.model.Disability>builder()
-              .put(Disability.TRUE, org.pmiops.workbench.rdr.model.Disability.TRUE)
-              .put(Disability.FALSE, org.pmiops.workbench.rdr.model.Disability.FALSE)
+              .put(Disability.TRUE, org.pmiops.workbench.rdr.model.Disability.YES)

replies.bodyText: RDR basically have three options not just TRUE and FALSE for DISABILITY: YES, NO ,PREFER_NOT_TO_ANSWER (L110)
replies.author: NehaBroad

timeline.bodyText:
Do you want the race field to be written to, or should the set of entries be fixed?
Clients might do researcher.getRace().add(Race.DAYTONA_500);, which works, but is counterintuitive.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: no RDR needs to simple take whatever value we give to them and not manipulate them
replies.author: NehaBroad

timeline.bodyText: Looks good. Passing in .ifPresent(researcher::setSexAtBirth) is more a matter of taste.
timeline.author: jaycarlton
